comments.html: If the threat model includes users potentially attacking the DHCP servers, wouldn't it make more sense to do port-based authentication (like dot1x or, in worst case, MAB) on user-facing ports? That way, by the time the DHCP traffic enters the network, the end-device is already authenticated/authorized and put into the proper VLAN.
comments.name: Gabriel
